speaker: narrator
dialog: While walking through the courtyard you soon catch the quiet melody of a harp.

speaker: narrator
dialog: Following the sound you soon come across Prince Thane sitting quietly on a bench in a hidden part of the courtyard.

speaker: narrator
dialog: He seems to not have noticed your pressence, continuing to play. What will you like to do?

speaker: narrator
dialog: You decide to wait and enjoy the music. Eventually Thane's melody comes to a close and he takes a pause.

speaker: thane
dialog: Whoevers there, you can step out now.

speaker: narrator
dialog: Busted. You sheepishly step out of the bushes and walk over, ready to apologize for intruding.

speaker: thane
dialog: Tell me, did you enjoy the music?

speaker: thane
dialog: I'm glad to hear that. Maybe sometime we could play together or if you don't have any experience I could teach you.

speaker: thane
dialog: I like that train of thought. We can always take the time to improve.

speaker: thane
dialog: Hm. I suppose the harp isn't for everyone.

speaker: thane
dialog: Well, look at the time. We better get going to class. I hope to see you again Mrs. Taylor.

speaker: narrator
dialog: And with that Thane is off. You get the feeling that Thane really enjoyed your company.

speaker: narrator
dialog: You step out of the bushes and pay a compliment to Prince Thane's playing.

speaker: narrator
dialog: He stops playing and looks up with a face of annoyancee before starting to pack up his harp.

speaker: thane
dialog: Thank you. Now if you'll excuse me.

speaker: narrator
dialog: Before you can say another word Prince Thane is off. You get the feeling that interrupting him put a damper on his mood.
